anime.description: "Bananya" are neither cats nor bananas, but cats hidden in bananas. They come out and play when people are not watching.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: thick line animation
tag.description: The characters are drawn with a thicker outline than is usually seen in anime.

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: crowdfunded
tag.description: This anime was funded, at least partially, through a campaign on a crowdfunding website (e.g. Kickstarter, Makuake).

episode.title: ばなにゃ, ねずみにゃ
Bananya and the Mouse, Nya
Bananya, Nezumi Nya
episode.summary: Bananya is busy doing cat things when he spots a mouse! Will his cat instincts take over?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, てれびにゃ
Bananya Watches TV, Nya
Bananya, TV Nya
episode.summary: Bananya spends some time channel surfing with the help of Baby Bananya. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, なかまたちにゃ
Bananya and Friends, Nya
Bananya, Nakama-tachi Nya
episode.summary: Meet all of Bananya`s adorable friends! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, にゃ
The Kitty Who Lives in a Banana
Bananya, Nya
episode.summary: Meet the adorable kitty who lives inside a banana! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, のらねこにゃ
Bananya and the Stray Cat, Nya
Bananya, Noraneko Nya
episode.summary: Bananya wakes from an afternoon nap to find a visitor peering in the window... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, まよなかにゃ
Bananya in the Middle of the Night, Nya
Bananya, Mayonaka Nya
episode.summary: Bananya and his friends explore the house late at night, when the dark, quiet atmosphere makes everything look different... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, おでかけにゃ
Bananya Goes Out, Nya
Bananya, Odekake Nya
episode.summary: Bananya falls asleep in Mama`s purse, and she unknowingly takes him to the supermarket! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, れいぞうこにゃ
Bananya and the Refrigerator, Nya
Bananya, Reizouko Nya
episode.summary: When someone in the house leaves the refrigerator door open, Bananya and friends can`t resist taking a look inside... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, おひるねにゃ
Bananya`s Afternoon Nap, Nya
Bananya, Ohirune Nya
episode.summary: Bananya is taking an afternoon nap, but some of his friends have other ideas... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, おさんぽにゃ
Bananya Takes a Walk, Nya
Bananya, Osanpo Nya
episode.summary: Bananya is bored, so he heads outside for a walk and a visit to a neighbor`s house. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, ふうせんにゃ
Bananya and the Balloon, Nya
Bananya, Fuusen Nya
episode.summary: A balloon quietly floats in the living room, and the bananyas can`t resist trying to grab it. But everyone knows cats and balloons are a dangerous combination... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, ばするーむにゃ
Bananya in the Bathroom, Nya
Bananya, Bathroom Nya
episode.summary: Bananya and his friends discover the bathroom, where they`re once again up to their usual mischief. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばなにゃ, おたんじょうびにゃ
Bananya and the Birthday, Nya
Bananya, Otanjoubi Nya
episode.summary: The mother of the household is busily preparing for a birthday party... and the bananyas decide to help! Source: crunchyroll
